Job Posting: 178360 - Position: S26 Product Intern, Money Movement 178360 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 02/28/2026 11:59 PM Through Employer Website 02/17/2026 12:05 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country Interac Corp. Suite 2400 - 200 Bay Street Toronto M5J 2J1 ON Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description Who We Are: 2026 - Summer S26 Product Intern, Money Movement 178360 Co-op Position Toronto, ON Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD 0.0 per hour for 0 Major List $21 to $23 Every transaction matters. Every Canadian matters. At Interac, we protect both - driving trust, security, and inclusion, so our digital economy thrives. Founded in 1984, Interac connects Canadians through secure digital payments, advanced identity verification and industry-leading fraud protection. Connecting banks, businesses, and individuals, Interac enables millions to send, receive, and manage money safely and effortlessly every day - across both digital and physical environments. As the backbone of Canada's financial ecosystem, Interac facilitates over 20 million transactions daily, supported by trusted partnerships with government and financial institutions. Consistently ranked as Canada's most reputable financial technology brand, Interac is deeply embedded in the daily lives of Canadians. Who You Will Work With: The intern will join Interac's Money Movement product team, working closely with product managers, engineers, designers, and business stakeholders. You will contribute to shaping product features, gathering insights, and driving key initiatives. This is a hands-on role that will be responsible for supporting the Money Movement team in driving product evolution and supporting day-to-day product activities. You are someone who can quickly understand (or rapidly learn) the payments ecosystem, demonstrate strong strategic capability, and bring fresh, forward looking ideas to work. What You Will Do: • Support the Product team in day-to-day activities with stakeholder groups (squads, sales, engineering, marketing, and partners) to address product-related issues and concerns. • Support early-stage strategy development for Interac e-Transfer in the retail, commerce, and business spaces • Provide general support to the product roadmap, defining requirements, conducting product research, and assisting in squads to deliver corporate objectives • Conduct market research and analyze user feedback to identify opportunities for product improvements • Prepare documentation and conduct research as requested by the squad and/or product team • Work with large, unclean data sources to visualize/democratize data and insights, assess emerging themes, and showcase how solutions could fit within the broader ecosystem Job Requirements What You Bring: • Currently completing an undergraduate degree from a creditable Canadian institution with a focus on Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Econometrics, Data Science, or a related field • Strong analytical, critical thinking, problem-solving, written, verbal communication, organization, and time management skills • Ability to collaborate in a cross-functional environment and work independently • Experience with data analysis, research and tools (Google Analytics/Sheets, SQL, Tableau, MS Excel) • Ability to translate user feedback into actionable product insights • Proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Power BI, MS Teams) with a preference for working knowledge of Excel • Although not required, you have some familiarity or previous experience with the following: • Basic knowledge or experience with sentiment analysis • Basic knowledge or experience with open-source software packages • Experience with SQL or Python for data analysis • Experience with product management tools like Jira, Trello, or Asana • Interest in software development or technical background Familiarity with product development processes and agile methodologies • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
